section.name: What is Quality-Project?
section.p: The goal of Quality-Project is to provide small Java libraries which assist you in writing higher quality code.
Currently it consists of two modules: Quality-Check and Quality-Test. Quality-Check provides basic runtime code quality checks. Quality-Test includes several tools improve the quality of unit tests.
Here's some example code to show both modules.

subsection.name: Quality-Check
subsection.p: We believe that all method arguments have to be checked for technical validity, to avoid technical errors such as NullPointerExceptions or IndexOutOfBoundsException. Quality-Check provides several checks to ensure your parameters are valid. For more information take a look in to the introduction.

subsection.name: Quality-Test
subsection.p: In our opinion unit tests should focus on testing algorithms and functional behaviour. Way to often you have to care about test data instead. Therefore, quality-test provides its Blueprint feature to construct objects where all attributes are filled with values.

section.name: Contribute

ul.li: Report bugs, feature requests and other issues in the issue tracking application. Questions can also be sent to our mailing list.

Help with the documentation by pointing out areas that are lacking or unclear, and if you are so inclined, submitting patches to correct it. You can quickly contribute rough thoughts by forking this project on GitHub or downloading at Sourceforge , or you can volunteer to help collate and organize information that is already there.
Some software metrics can be found on our Continuous Integration server at Buildhive or Ohloh.

section.p: Your participation in this project is much appreciated!
